results.title: Enhancing Detection of Human Trafficking Act
results.short_title: Enhancing Detection of Human Trafficking Act
results.committees: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee
results.latest_major_action: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.
results.summary: Enhancing Detection of Human Trafficking Act This bill directs the Department of Labor to implement a program to: (1) train and periodically retrain relevant Labor personnel to detect and assist law enforcement in preventing human trafficking during the course of their primary roles and responsibilities, and (2) ensure that such personnel regularly receive current information on matters related to the detection of human trafficking. Labor shall report annually to Congress regarding the effectiveness of the training, the number of Labor employees who have completed such training, and the number of of human trafficking cases referred to Labor personnel.

actions.description: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H5486)
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H5486-5488)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2664.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Walberg moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
